If you were to load the file using pickle alone, I'd suggest trying to load it using encoding='latin1' for example.

with open(myfile, 'rb') as f:
    data = pickle.load(f, encoding='latin1')

This has solved issues for me when deserializing some pickle files saved on python2 and loaded on python3. But to make it work out-of-the-box on torch.load might require extending the API.

body:
If you were to load the file using pickle alone, I'd suggest trying to load it using `encoding='latin1'` for example.
```python
with open(myfile, 'rb') as f:
    data = pickle.load(f, encoding='latin1')
```
This has solved issues for me when deserializing some pickle files saved on python2 and loaded on python3. But to make it work out-of-the-box on `torch.load` might require extending the API.
